subject: OS-6768 overlays should be capable of L3 routing - Overlay header/interface updates for VL3 routing - Overlay annotations where changes are needed - Overlay: remove defines for union resolution - libsvp: Update with overlay_target.h changes - More TODO co
commitMessage:
OS-6768 overlays should be capable of L3 routing
- Overlay header/interface updates for VL3 routing
- Overlay annotations where changes are needed
- Overlay: remove defines for union resolution
- libsvp: Update with overlay_target.h changes
- More TODO comments
- Add OVERLAY_PROP_T_ETHER plus svp/dcid & svp/router_mac properties.
- missing mutex_exit in varpd_svp_getprop
- Stub for varpd_files_lookup_l3
- Stub for varpd_files_lookup_l3 (fix)
- Updated overlay_target.h definitions
- Fix .WAIT in Makefile
- New SVP messages & a version addition, but still WIP, on varpd
  Reviewed by: Jason King <jbk@joyent.com>
- overlay_target_entry needs a spot for vlan
- Add dcid property to overlay
- Update varpd_files to support VL3->UL3 lookups
- Restore SVP_R_ROUTE_REQ, and all that goes with it.
  Interpret sl3a_uport == 0 in SVP_R_VL3_ACK to indicate the VL3 IP
  is a next-hop router.
  Add "route" log messages for shootdowns.
- Add router flag for VL2 entries
- Overlay fabric router
- OS-6980 small leak in libvarpd
- Lose KEBE comments in libvarp_svp.c
- Update overlay comments
- Version bump SVP to 2
- Can't check length for SVP_R_LOG_ACK
- fix overlay_ip_avl
- Change svp_vl3_lookup_cb() to cope with portolan that can only be manually
  hacked so much...
- libvard_inject_varpd needs to know about routers
- Undo svp_vl3_lookup_cb() changes
  Malformed svp_query_t for route lookup
  Explicitly pad svp_route_ack_t
  Missing byte-order calls
- Improve mblk handling when examining IP header
- add drop probes
- Zero-length looped-back mblk hack
- Interface additions for route shootdowns
- Route removal
- Support route deletion entries in SVP_R_LOG_ACK.
- Fix routing latency spikes
- Fix non-shared VL2 target init
- add SVP support to snoop
- Invalidate VL3 entries when VL2 entries lose route info
- Fix (hopefully) lock ott_lock and ote_lock inversion
- move target cache allocation outside of locks
- fix DEBUG build
- fix prefix len in snoop
- Fix LOG vlan field ordering
- fix net delete search
- More lock fixing
- don't mark pending VL2 entries valid from route response
- Fix removal of VL3 entries on unattach
- Fix VL2 refleak
- Delete VL3 entry on target DROP response
- OS-6847 vxlan header allocation should think about mblk chains
- Goodbye sarc, hello 2Q
- Allow adjustment of 2Q cache sizes while running
- 2Q usr/src/test tests
- varpd still needs libcmdutils for list_* functions

subject: Ignore spaces around the probe specifier name in dtrace's output.
commitMessage:
Ignore spaces around the probe specifier name in dtrace's output.

When using one of the tracing options, such as -n, -i, -P, -f, if
the probe specifier contains any leading or trailing spaces, then
the first line of output produced by dtrace prints the probe name as
it is (along with the spaces). Moreover, if the probe also includes
a predicate or an action, then also there is a trailing space in the
probe name in the output. Following are couple of examples:

localhost$ sudo dtrace -n '  syscall:::entry '
dtrace: description '  syscall:::entry ' matched 482 probes

lcalhost$ sudo dtrace -n 'syscall:::entry {@num[probefunc] = count();}'
dtrace: description 'syscall:::entry ' matched 482 probes

This change skips the leading spaces in the probe name before
starting to process them. Also, when splitting the probe name
from the predicate and actions in compile_str(), it uses space
as one of the separators so that any trailing space after the
probe name will also be avoided in the output.

Also, add a test case (dtraceUtil/tst.TestProbeDescription.d.ksh) - which
checks that there are no leading or trailing spaces in the probe name
in dtrace's output when used using the -n option.
